title: PSA that 'Broken' and "Too Strong" are not the same thing
body:
This essay is listed in my ["Master List of Essay Threads"](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/dIOKMXh6-master-list-of-my-essay-threads) under the title "On To Be Broken"
_____

A champ that's too strong just needs some numbers tuned back.

A champ that's actually broken can be strong or weak at the moment, but that's not the point. Being broken means that the way their abilities work prevent them from being allowed to be strong by Riot since they warp the game in an unreasonable or unhealthy way that force players to play in an extremely unsatisfying or counter intuitive way, or which present false decisions to players.

Poppy is broken because of her ultimate and the fact that her passive actively discourages you from trying to finish her off the lower her health gets. She is not allowed to be strong because she makes the game unfun and her existence prevents others from making meaningful decisions. 

Unless the champ you're talking about is fundamentally flawed in ways that warp the entire game in an unhealthy way, they aren't broken.

I'd make a case for fizz. His kit is toxic to play against.

I'd say Fizz is more toxic than broken. Toxic to me means that they are just frustrating as hell to play against. Broken is there is something about one ability or their entire kit that gives them so much strength it can't be resolved with numbers. If Fizz had a reasonable cool down on his e it may still be annoying but when its down maybe you can punish that.

You know typing this makes me think he's toxic and broken....
I'd argue that Fizz's E is broken and can't be balanced with just numbers, but you make a good point about the toxic thing.

It has way too much on it right now, to the point that it is broken, totally see that. It's his wave clear, max first ability (AP fizz), gap closer, escape, general survivability, AOE nuke etc. I think the E could be balanced if it got reworked into a pure utility ability, this could wreck Fizz though because it is his only wave clear. So ya, kind of broken.

PS: I was typing out another reply but the same thing happened as my last post...this fish man

I also think Fizz is too strong, but his other abilities are relatively weak compared to his E. His Q is basically a gapcloser that barely does anything more than an auto attack. His W does a lot of damage, but he has to be in melee range to do it, and that's all it is, damage. His E has most of his power, and that means that he has to decide whether he uses it for damage, to dodge something, or for a gapcloser, or an escape. A good Fizz will use his E to do 2 or 3 of those things at the same time.

His ult is pretty strong too, but it can sometimes be hard to land.

Other champions have been plagued with balance issues by having one ability having way too much power on it. I'm not saying take things of the E and he will be fine, just that he would be in a more balancable state.

I also find his Q to actually be deceptively strong at times. Good fizzes have juked me hard with it. Overall it is somewhat bland. But I do like abilities that have these kinds of subtle uses/power.

Yorick is honestly not broken, Riot just wants to think so. There are champions that do what he does, but even better and actually have a good late game too. 

Champs like Gnar, Vlad and Lulu come to mind. The new GP and Darius also fill his role pretty well, as well.

Only reason he is broken is cuz they gave him meaninglessly weak abilities on low cooldowns with low mana costs. They practically beg him to build tear and spam all day.

If his abilities were on a longer, more meaningful cd and actually had visible impact he'd be much more playable and play-against-able.
They would also need to make his ghouls easily auto attackable, as it is you need to attack move just to hit them at all or use a skillshot.

Or have Ghouls be untargetable/unkillable and balanced around that factor ie. not as strong as they currently are that way they are far less binary in their effectiveness. Currently an untouched Ghoul that is allowed to freely attack the enemy laner will do tons of damage. But if there is strong AoE presence then the Ghouls have no effect at all.

Having Ghouls be used in more unique ways than quickly chase enemy and auto them would probably make the character more interesting. A few ideas would be like having the Q ghoul act more as a target reveal by chasing the target at extreme speeds but dealing low damage, perhaps even leaving a trail for Yorick. W spawning a hulking ghoul that slowly trudges toward the target, inflicting a massive slow on its attacks if it reaches its target. E could be a stationary sentry that saps the life from enemies in an area around it.

Basically the idea is to have ghouls be more than just the same copy paste run towards them and auto ghoul while also providing reasoning behind having a longer cooldown on the spells that spawn them.

This matches my definition.
Of course, people tend to disagree on exactly which champions this applies to, as well as mis-using the word for other meanings.

>**Broken**
>A champion or ability that lacks sufficient counterplay, or a champion that doesn't have enough weaknesses given their strengths.
>Related to: Overloaded
>Not to be mistaken with: Overpowered
>Being broken is a design issue, and cannot be easily fixed by merely adjusting numbers (e.g. the champion needs a rework to resolve their problems.)

[League of Legends Gameplay and Balance Glossary ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/3vjheXWz-league-of-legends-gameplay-and-balance-glossary)

Garen needs whoever he ults to have got the last kill and be below half health. This is what people are complaining about with him. If Fiora was broke, Garen is broke. No counterplay, even more situational. If they have to nerf a champs to being useless outside of the ult because they feel it is too strong and can't be countered, that is broken.

That's not why she was reworked. She was reworked because she didn't deliver on the fencing fantasy, and she was a melee carry who was 100% useless when behind. The fact that her ult was so ridiculous was what kept her relevant. They changed her up to better match her fantasy and make her less feast or famine.

Doesn't negate Garen's current broken-ness (probably more gimped, as of now). I'll agree he's broken, but the key thing here is he's broken and _weak_ because of it. As Azrolator says, he's situational, nigh-uncounterable, and relies on a sword over his target's head to kill.
